definition: bay bridge (elevated bridge across stretch of water)
to step across/to stride over/to straddle/to span
ocean/sea/CL:個|个[ge4],片[pian4]/great number of people or things/(dialect) numerous
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother

sentences.english: Its beautiful arched bridge gate is a sign of this bridge.
sentences.chinese: 橋前一道美麗的拱形橋門，是跨海大橋的象徵。

sentences.english: With the opening of the bridge, the value of great natural environment in Dinghai becomes increasingly important.
sentences.chinese: 隨着跨海大橋的開通，定海自然環境的價值日益凸顯。

sentences.english: The new zone sits on the northern end of the cross-sea Hangzhou Bay Bridge.
sentences.chinese: 大橋新區位於杭州灣跨海大橋北堍。

sentences.english: China's Hangzhou Bay Bridge will become the world's longest trans-oceanic bridge.
sentences.chinese: 中國的杭州灣大橋將成爲世界上最長的跨海大橋。

sentences.english: It has only 23 km to Hangzhou Bay Cross-Sea Bridge.
sentences.chinese: 基地距杭州灣跨海大橋只有23公里。

sentences.english: Hong Kong-Zhuhai-Macao Bridge is the world's longest crossing Sea Bridge.
sentences.chinese: 港珠澳大橋成爲世界最長的跨海大橋。

definition: a hot tourist attraction/a tourist trap
sea land air (transport, or military operations)
Da Qiao, one of the Two Qiaos, according to Romance of the Three Kingdoms 三國演義|三国演义[San1 guo2 Yan3 yi4], the two great beauties of ancient China
monkey (dialect)/little monkey (affectionate term for children, subordinates)
